reviews.review_msg: She is retiring this year, and that is a good thing. She was intimidating, and did not respond well to the students. She cannot work with technology and she is a poor lecturer. Hopefully this course can have a fresh perspective in 2016/2017.
She seemed to have difficulty getting her thoughts across to her students. Her grading scheme was also quite challenging for a writing intensive course (e.g A- = 85-90%).
Yes, in this course she did just read off of her slide...

This prof wasnt the best lecturer, but her ideas are interesting. I dont agree with them, but they're interesting. There isnt much chance for interaction in this class, but the tutorials do that really well. Notes are clear.

The stuff that she'd picked out to read was actually really interesting. But generally long. The lectures ... she does read off the paper. But her notes were very precise. There is no final, and as long as you put the effort in, you'll do well on the essays. I didnt agree with everything she said, but her views were interesting.

She reads off her notes, it is literally all scripted. There is no final for this course but three papers on one case study. I learned alot, just hard to focus. Framed writes every so often for class. Tutorials were very well coordinated with the lecture!

Luckily the TA marked the assignments and exams. There is generally no leeway for critical thinking in her class. Class is pretty easy, did not at all like the textbook since it dismissed several important causations behind homelessness and poverty.
I learned a lot from this course.
Not a good teacher...  She has some crazy ideas about reality
I thought Janet had plenty experience with the material she was presenting, but she didn't make her lecture notes clear or understandable. The class had no guidance or rubrics for our papers
The three gorges dam lecture was the best.  The tutorial helped me to learn the material.  She is very helpful.

An interesting class, but be prepared to work hard. Instead of exams, this course requires a number of papers, which is actually very useful for learning the course material. Janet is helpful outside of class and definitely provides thoughtful and helpful feedback on coursework. In fact, few other professors provide such quick, constructive feedbac

An interesting course with potential, but because Janet teaches it it can be very boring. She talks slowly and doesn't exhibit much enthusiasm in her lectures. I suggest taking the course with a different professor.

Janet is unpersonable, unfriendly, narrow minded and rude. Her facilitation of the course is disappointing. Rather than encouraging participation and discussion during seminars she can be sharp and condescending thus inhibiting one from wanting to speak up.
nice lady, but boring course. sticks to her chosen approach all the time without necessity. nevertheless, very interesting anecdotes from china all the time.

Horrible course...worse tutorial. Janet is a nice enough lady. 241 with her was good, but the material in this course is vague and outdated (the t/a's will attest to this). The t/a's themselves are sub-par as well.  If you don't need to do this course DONT.
She is great proof! and helpful when you have difficulties...

She was not specific at all as to what she expects of you, even when you ask her (over and over), yet when it comes to marking she has very clear expectations. In other words she makes it difficult for you to do well. When you ask her to clarify something she doesn't, she just tells you to read the assignment again, and she's very rude about it.

You're supposed to fiigure out the links and connectedness on your own if there are any. The real world isn't as simple and dumbed down as acedamia likes to make it. I really appreciate that she doesn't do this. However, tutorial for the class was AWFUL, and very unnecessary, but I plan on taking her classes again anyway.

Do not see the connections among the topics, and the teacher does not even attempt to show the links. She is inexperienced in the classroom. Hope she gets better in the short time remaining before retirement!!

Prepare for idiosyncrasies in her class that stem from her vagueness and lack of teaching ability. The problems with her lectures will be quite apparent from the start, which means the students' interest in the course will be lost long before the final class.

horrible teacher....worst teacher i have ever had...never want another class with her....she is very vague on how she wants assignments done, attending class just makes eveything even more confusing...be warned...
She is good proof. As long as attending all lecture and tutorial, you must do very fine with her course.

Papers are very easy with low expectations. Lecture material can sometimes be unclear but is still straightforward. Her examples are not very helpful and it seems that she struggles sometimes to get her thoughts out. Overall, still an easy course for someone who has any knowledge about the environment and environmental processes.
horrible teacher, does not clarify what she wants, and soooo horrible at answering students questions.
The TA's marking is brutal and really inconsistant. Teacher lectures directly off power point slides. Assigned readings are more critical than text readings.
